business.headline: India on track to become 2nd largest economy by 2038: ReportWith a combination of a young population, rising domestic consumption, fiscal discipline, and structural reforms, India appears well-positioned to climb the global economic ladder in the coming decades.

Don't miss this step after filing ITR: Here's what to doSimply filing your ITR is not enough. You must verify it within 30 days, else, missing this important step could mean delays, penalties, and even your return being declared invalid.

Why is Trump targeting India with tariffs? Raghuram Rajan explainsFormer RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan said that US President Donald Trump's decision to impose steep tariffs, including a 50% duty on Indian goods, is part of a wider strategy that goes beyond trade economics.

GST 2.0 boost for textile, fertiliser sectors as Trump's 50% tariff kicks inThe textile and fertiliser industries are expected to be among the biggest beneficiaries of the upcoming GST 2.0 rationalisation amid US President Donald Trump's 50% tariff.

Dividend mismatch with AIS? Here's how taxpayers should report itFiling ITR often becomes confusing when dividend income in your personal records doesn't match what appears in AIS. Here's how to handle it while filing ITR.

Cheaper milk, chocolates, clothes and more: How GST 2.0 could slash your billsThe proposed changes, to be discussed at the Council's meeting on September 3–4 in New Delhi, focus on widening the nil rate, scrapping the 12% slab, and reducing rates on selected 18% goods.

Sensex tanks 600 points: Why is stock market falling today?The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 605.97 points to 80,180.57, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 173.50 points to 24,538.55, as both the indices continued their downward movement.
Sensex nosedives 600 points, Nifty tumbles as US tariffs hit marketsThe Sensex shed 600 points to close at 81,074, while the Nifty ended below the 24,600 mark after slipping into bearish territory.
High-end electric vehicles likely to attract 18% GSTAccording to the proposals, GST on four-wheeled EVs priced between Rs 20 lakh and Rs 40 lakh will be raised from 5 per cent to 18 per cent.
Chocolates with cocoa, pastries, ice cream likely to be taxed at 5% instead of 18%The proposed rationalisation stems from the Council's broader push to simplify the GST framework.

Condensed milk, dates, jams, mushrooms, namkeens to get cheaper under GST 2.0The fitment committee has proposed that products such as butter, condensed milk, jams, mushrooms, dates, nuts, and namkeens move from the current 12 per cent GST slab to just 5 per cent.

PM SVANidhi scheme extended till 2030, higher loans and credit cards for vendorsThe move is expected to benefit 1.15 crore street vendors, including 50 lakh new beneficiaries. The scheme will continue to be implemented jointly by the Ministry of Housing & Urban Affairs (MoHUA) and the Department of Financial Services (DFS).

India eyes new markets amid US tariffs, aims to boost textile, jewellery exportsPlans are being drawn up to explore new markets, increase outreach, and give special attention to sectors such as textiles and gems and jewellery, which are likely to be among the hardest hit by the tariff.
Can a Rs 10,000 monthly SIP make you a crorepati? Here's the timelineCan Rs 10,000 a month really make you a crorepati? The maths of SIPs shows that with discipline and time, the answer is yes.

These 3 banks offer special FDs with higher interest rates till September 2025For those planning to invest in FDs, three banks are running special schemes with better interest rates valid up to September 2025.

How will Trump's 50% tariff impact India's growth?The 50% tariff by the US comes at a time when India has reported strong growth of 6.5% in 2024–25 and has been projected to remain the fastest-growing major economy.

Filing ITR for FY 2024-25? Keep these 6 documents handyKeeping your documents in order is the first step to a smooth filing process. Not having the documents in place not only delays the process but also increases the chance of errors in the return.

Indian crypto platforms boom in grey zone, says Zerodha's Nithin KamathTraders are increasingly drawn to futures and options (F&O) products in digital assets, lured by high leverage and lower tax costs compared to traditional markets.

Trump's 50% tariff shock: How can exporters shield themselvesThe tariff was announced as a response to India's continued trade with Russia, and it now places Indian products at a disadvantage in the American market.

New to ITR filing? Here's how to create your account on the e-filing portalNew taxpayers often wonder how to start their ITR journey, and the answer is simple: create your account on the e-filing portal to access all tax-related services.

Indian leather industry eyes expansion in Russian, African markets amid US tariffsTrade delegations are set to visit Russia and Africa soon, with Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal expected to lead the mission in Russia. Buyer-seller meets are also planned in African countries.

Ganesh Chaturthi 2025: Is stock market open for trading today?The stock market holiday list for 2025 is available on the official BSE (Bombay Stock Exchange) website. Earlier, markets were closed on August 15 for Independence Day.
How will Trump's 50% tariff impact Indian economy and its exports?The United States has escalated its trade dispute with India, imposing new tariffs that bring the total rate to 50% on certain goods.

How will Trump's 50% tariff impact Indian economy? Experts weigh inThe discussion centres on the implications of a 50% tariff threatened by Donald Trump on Indian goods. Experts analyse the potential impact on India's economy, particularly labour-intensive sectors such as textiles, leather, gems and jewellery.

Papa John's to return to India with Bengaluru outlet, plans 650 stores by 2035US-based Papa John's will re-enter India this October, opening its first store in Bengaluru and targeting 650 outlets by 2035. The pizza chain, which exited in 2017 due to poor performance, has partnered with Pulsar Capital and UAE's PJP Investments Group as master franchisees.

TCS appoints Amit Kapur to lead new AI and services transformation unitIn a bid to deepen its AI capabilities, TCS has named Amit Kapur as the head of its newly formed AI and services transformation unit, effective September.

No credit history? How lenders are opening doors for new borrowersFor decades, a blank credit history meant a closed door to loans. Now, fintechs and banks are rewriting the rules—using digital footprints and alternative data to bring first-time borrowers into the fold.

PM holds high-level meet on US tariff impact, explores relief for exportersThe PMO on Tuesday held a high-level meeting with senior ministers and officials from the Finance and Commerce Ministries to frame India's response to the US decision to double tariffs on Indian goods to 50% from Wednesday.

New Income Tax Act's password override: Privacy threat or necessary power?India's new tax law brings a digital twist; officials can now override passwords during raids. Supporters say it's just enforcement in the digital age, but privacy advocates worry about unchecked surveillance.
Sensex slumps 849 points, Nifty below 24,750; Tata Steel down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex tanked 849.37 points to close at 80,786.54, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 255.70 points to end at 24,712.05.

Woman got tax notice of Rs 2.58 crore. Here's how she reduced it to Rs 0Seema found herself staring at a tax notice of Rs 2.58 crore after selling a piece of land in Patna. The confusion arose due to a simple error in her tax return.

Trump's 50% tariff takes effect tomorrow: Who wins, who losesThe United States government has issued a draft notification confirming the step, which will be applied through a supplementary 25% duty on top of existing tariffs.

What India really needs to become 'Viksit Bharat' by 2047IndiaToday.in reached out to leading economists to understand what India must do over the next two decades to achieve its 'Viksit Bharat' vision. Here's what they had to say.
HDFC Bank share crash explained: Did it actually fall over 50%?HDFC Bank's shares appeared to have tanked over 50% compared to the previous close on Dalal Street in early trade.

Switching from UPS to NPS? Here's what employees must knowCentral government employees now have a one-time chance to switch from the Unified Pension Scheme (UPS) to the National Pension System (NPS). But the move comes with strict rules, deadlines, and conditions.

Simplified, new tax rules and forms: What you need to knowThe Income Tax department is working on new rules and forms under the Income-tax Act, 2025, which will be notified by December-end to ensure a smoother, simpler process for taxpayers.

Once 'white gold', cotton turns into burden for India's farmersAt present, cotton cultivation area, production, and productivity are all going down. In just two years, the cotton cultivation area has fallen by 14.8 lakh hectares, while production has dropped by 42.35 lakh bales.

Sensex crashes 900 points: Why is stock market down today?The BSE Sensex showed a negative start as trading commenced today, with most stocks tanking at the opening bell. Sensex and Nifty fell nearly 1% a few minutes after opening for trading.

Sensex, Nifty tank nearly 1% as US tariff fears spook D-Street investorsThe Sensex fell over 500 points, while the Nifty slipped below the psychological 24,900 mark in early trade, mirroring global risk-off cues.

What is the 10-30-50 formula? Edelweiss MF's Radhika Gupta on smart money habitsRadhika Gupta explained that this tug of war between splurging and saving is not new. In fact, she advised a simple rule for different life stages, i.e., the 10-30-50 principle.

entertainment.headline: Archana Puran Singh on rough marriage patch with Parmeet Sethi: Ego got in the wayArchana Puran Singh shared that her marriage with Parmeet Sethi once went through a rough patch due to ego clashes, but meditation helped them rediscover their love. She shared that despite frequent fights, they cannot live without each other and remain strong partners after over three decades together.

Special Ops 2 director Neeraj Pandey prefers subtle patriotism to chest thumpingDirector Neeraj Pandey spoke about his subtle approach to patriotism in films and his experience making 'Special Ops'. In an exclusive with India Today, he also highlighted the importance of clarity in storytelling.

R Madhavan stuck in Leh amid rains, recalls similar ordeal during 3 Idiots shootR Madhavan shared a view from his hotel room window, capturing snow-clad mountain peaks under cloudy skies, while also speaking about the weather.

Kriti Sanon's Do Patti song Raanjhan faces plagiarism rowKriti Sanon's song 'Raanjhan' from the film Do Patti, which enjoyed immense popularity, is now embroiled in a plagiarism controversy involving an international music producer.

Actor Lavanya Tripathi flaunts baby bump at Ganpati celebrations with Varun TejTelugu actors Varun Tej and Lavanya Tripathi, who are soon to be parents shared photos of themselves offering prayers to Lord Ganesha, and fans were quick to respond.

Prabhas to wrap The Raja Saab by October end before starting SpiritPrabhas aims to finish shooting 'The Raja Saab' by the end of October 2025. The actor will then focus on his next project 'Spirit', marking a busy schedule ahead.

Shamita Shetty on breakup with Raqesh Bapat: An erased chapter in my lifeShamita Shetty opened up about her breakup with Raqesh Bapat, calling it an "erased chapter" from her life and stressing that their bond was limited to the 'Bigg Boss' house. She added that as an independent woman, she values peace over companionship and won't compromise until she finds someone who truly respects her.

Singer Enrique Iglesias and tennis star Anna Kournikova to welcome fourth childSinger Enrique Iglesias and Anna Kournikova are expecting their fourth child, with the former tennis star already halfway through her pregnancy and doing well. The couple, who share three children, will soon expand their family while continuing life together in Miami.

Top films and shows to watch on Netflix this weekendThis weekend, Netflix has unveiled a diverse collection of new content spanning romance, drama, comedies and documentaries. Here's a glimpse at the latest shows and films for you to add to your binge-watch list.

Bigg Boss 19 episode 4: Gaurav-Zeeshan clash over food, captaincy race begins'Bigg Boss 19' saw high drama in episode 4 as Gaurav Khanna and Zeeshan Qadri clashed over food, with housemates accusing Gaurav of eating extra dal. The episode also featured the season's first captaincy task.

KBC 17: Bihar contestant fails to answer Rs 50 lakh question on Red Fort. Can you?In the latest episode of 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17', a contestant from Bihar failed to answer a Rs 50 lakh question on Delhi's Red Fort. He walked off with Rs 25 lakh from the show.

Ssunita Ahuja denies comparing Yash and Ahaan Panday, says don't spread rumoursSsunita Ahuja clarified that she never compared her son Yash's debut with Ahaan Panday's 'Saiyaara', praising the young actor and urging fans not to spread rumours. She also wished success to all newcomers.

Janhvi Kapoor, Sidharth Malhotra visit Shirdi ahead of Param Sundari release. WatchAhead of 'Param Sundari' release, Janhvi Kapoor and Sidharth Malhotra offered prayers at Shirdi. Video of the two stars seeking blessings has gone viral.

Proud Maa Sushmita Sen rings in daughter Alisah's sweet 16 with emotional noteSushmita Sen celebrated her younger daughter Alisah's 16th birthday with a heartfelt Instagram post, sharing pictures and a loving note. She called herself a proud mother in the post.

Salman Khan performs aarti during Ganesh Chaturthi celebration with family. WatchSalman Khan and his family celebrated Ganesh Chaturthi 2025 with devotion at Arpita Khan Sharma's Mumbai residence. Joined by parents Salim and Salma Khan, the actor performed the aarti, and the video has gone viral.

MrBeast slammed for mocking Rolling Stone list after Caleb Hearon outranks himMrBeast faced backlash after mocking Rolling Stone's creator rankings, where Caleb Hearon ranked higher. Critics said he reduced influence to follower counts, while fans defended his unmatched reach.

Ekta Kapoor cautions actors against fake audition calls for Balaji TelefilmsProducer Ekta Kapoor issued an official statement through the social media handle of Balaji Telefilms warning actors against fraudulent casting directors impersonating their staff. The alert aims to protect aspiring actors from scams and misuse of the company's name.

Harry Potter shops with Hagrid at Diagon Alley and more in new pics from HBO showThe pictures from the new 'Harry Potter' series surfaced on the internet. The upcoming show is based on the original book while also introducing new elements like the full Weasley family.

Google marks Taylor and Travis's engagement with golden hearts and diamondsTaylor Swift and Travis Kelce are engaged! Google celebrates the couple's big news with golden hearts and diamonds in search results.

general news.headline: PM Modi to meet Xi Jinping on Aug 31 during his first visit to China in 7 yearsPrime Minister Narendra Modi will meet Chinese President Xi Jinping on August 31 in Tianjin during the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) summit, his first visit to China in over seven years.

PM Modi, mother abused during Rahul Gandhi's Bihar rally, BJP seeks apologyThe video shows Congress workers using derogatory language against PM Modi from the stage that was set up for the 'Voter Adhikar Yatra'. However, Rahul Gandhi was not present during the incident.

Why is Trump targeting India with tariffs? Raghuram Rajan explainsFormer RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan said that US President Donald Trump's decision to impose steep tariffs, including a 50% duty on Indian goods, is part of a wider strategy that goes beyond trade economics.

'Nikki said cylinder blast caused burns': Noida dowry death probe takes new turnThe new revelation marks a shift from earlier allegations that Nikki, 26, was set on fire by her husband Vipin Bhati and his family over dowry demands.

Ground report: Key highway to Manali blocked, flood waters pass through toll boothIncessant rain has submerged the Kullu toll plaza, washed away over 200 meters of the Chandigarh-Manali Highway, and left hundreds stranded as landslides, flash floods, and cloudbursts batter Himachal Pradesh.

India on track to become 2nd largest economy by 2038: ReportWith a combination of a young population, rising domestic consumption, fiscal discipline, and structural reforms, India appears well-positioned to climb the global economic ladder in the coming decades.

Is Trump now targeting India's soft exports with H-1B, student visa crackdown?The H-1B visa, which has got the US some of its top engineers and CEOs, is now being branded a "scam" by the Trump administration. After the 50% tariffs on Indian products, is President Donald Trump now targeting India's soft exports with a crackdown on H-1B, student visas and Green Cards?

Pakistani rape gangs exploited children in 85 areas in UK, MP's probe findsA British MP-led probe has uncovered child sexual exploitation by grooming gangs made up mostly of Pakistani men in 85 UK areas. The investigation alleges decades of targeted abuse and calls out official failures to protect victims.

Minneapolis shooter scrawled 'Nuke India', 'Mashallah' on guns used in attackThe Minneapolis school shooting left two children dead and 17 injured, with authorities confirming the gunman's weapons carried antisemitic, anti-India and anti-Israel slogans.

Intel warns of 3 Jaish terrorists entering Bihar via Nepal, state on high alertThe Bihar Police Headquarters said three suspected members of the Pakistan-based terror outfit Jaish-e-Mohammed infiltrated Bihar through the Nepal border.

Seems like it's not about Ukraine: Democrats blast Trump for singling out IndiaThe criticism came a day after Donald Trump's revised tariff policy on India came into effect. The president had initially announced 25 per cent "reciprocal tariffs" on Indian goods but later doubled the figure to 50 per cent, calling it a penalty for New Delhi's continued oil imports from Russia.

F-35 pilot's 50-minute call with engineers mid-air. Then jet fell out of the skyThe F-35 pilot spent nearly an hour on a conference call with engineers from Lockheed Martin to troubleshoot the issue with the jet. But they were unable to rectify the issue, and the aircraft went into freefall.
Dubai princess, who divorced husband on Instagram, engaged to rapper French MontanaDubai princess Sheikha Mahra Mohammed Rashed Al Maktoum is engaged to Moroccan-American rapper French Montana.

Getting in bed with authoritarians: Trump aide warns India on China, RussiaThe outburst came on Wednesday, just hours after the United States imposed sweeping 50 per cent tariffs on Indian goods. Peter Navarro said India's continued purchase of discounted Russian crude was directly fuelling Moscow's war in Ukraine, which he repeatedly labelled "Modi's war".
How climate change is quietly reshaping Indian riversFlooding and rising river water temperatures have been exacerbated due to climate change, threatening lives, livelihoods, and biodiversity.

How India sprung back after US sanctions 27 years agoFrom economic sanctions to reciprocal tariffs, the US has many a time tried to pressurise India through aid cuts, blocking international loans, and bans on technology transfers. Yet, deft Indian diplomacy and indigenous growth not only ensured the rollback of these punitive actions but also resulted in stronger bilateral ties. Here's how India, over 25 years ago, shrugged off American sanctions and emerged stronger.

Salman Khan performs aarti during Ganesh Chaturthi celebration with family. WatchSalman Khan and his family celebrated Ganesh Chaturthi 2025 with devotion at Arpita Khan Sharma's Mumbai residence. Joined by parents Salim and Salma Khan, the actor performed the aarti, and the video has gone viral.

Indian astronaut shares the athlete-scientist-diplomat codeGp. Capt. P Balakrishnan Nair said that the Ax-4 training program was both "rigorous and fun," offering a steep yet rewarding curve for those stepping into the demanding world of spaceflight preparation.

100-year-old held in 'digital arrest' for 6 days in Lucknow, son pays Rs 1.29 crFraudsters posing as CBI officers trapped a 100-year-old man in a six-day "digital arrest" in Lucknow, forcing his son, a retired Merchant Navy officer, to transfer Rs 1.29 crore into multiple accounts.

Neeraj Chopra targets Diamond League win to reclaim top spotIndia's javelin ace Neeraj Chopra returns to the Diamond League Final in Zurich, chasing a second Diamond Trophy. With Julian Weber and Anderson Peters in the fray, the meet serves as the perfect prelude to next month's World Championships.

Why parents still prefer a 'sarkari damad' over a startup CEOIndian parents continue to prefer government jobs for marriage proposals despite startup success. The pandemic reinforced the value of job security and social respect in matrimonial choices.

Blatant, brazen: How Trump Cabinet is on the warpath for Peace NobelWhat earlier seemed to be Donald Trump's lone pursuit has now become a task for his Cabinet. All the President's men and women are singing his praise, which is unabashedly being broadcast, with the goal of cornering the Nobel Peace Prize for Trump. The brazen and unabashed lobbying comes at a time the Norwegian Nobel Committee must be working hard to pick a winner for an announcement in October.

Touched her waist, chest: Andhra lecturer arrested for harassing minor studentA chemistry lecturer at a government college in Andhra Pradesh was arrested for misbehaving with a 17-year-old student. The incident happened on campus during class hours. Police booked him under the Pocso Act and remanded him.

Satya Nadella reveals 5 GPT-5 prompts he uses daily to run Microsoft efficientlyIn this AI era, Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella shared a few prompts that keep him ahead in meetings. His statement highlights that Copilot is no longer only about drafting memos or writing summaries.

sports.headline: Wanindu Hasaranga out of Zimbabwe T20Is, Sri Lanka face injury scare before Asia CupSri Lanka's Asia Cup preparations have been hit with Wanindu Hasaranga sidelined due to a hamstring injury, ruling him out of the Zimbabwe T20I series. With key fixtures in Harare from August 29 to September 7, the team will rely on youngsters to fill the all-rounder's void.

Dhruv Jurel, Abhimanyu Easwaran miss Duleep ties with fever and groin injuryCentral Zone captain Dhruv Jurel and East Zone skipper Abhimanyu Easwaran missed the Duleep Trophy quarterfinals, which began on Thursday, due to a fever and a groin niggle, respectively.

Neeraj Chopra targets Diamond League win to reclaim top spotIndia's javelin ace Neeraj Chopra returns to the Diamond League Final in Zurich, chasing a second Diamond Trophy. With Julian Weber and Anderson Peters in the fray, the meet serves as the perfect prelude to next month's World Championships.

England's batting line-up will be unbelievable in Ashes: Josh HazlewoodAustralian fast bowler Josh Hazlewood has described the upcoming Ashes series as one of the biggest tests of his career, as he prepares to take on what he calls a strong England batting line-up.

US Open 2025, Day 5, Order of Play: Swiatek, Sinner, Gauff aim for Round 3 berthsUS Open 2025: Day 5 promises high-intensity action with top seeds Iga Swiatek, Jannik Sinner, Coco Gauff, and Alexander Zverev headlining the singles schedule.

Lionel Messi powers Inter Miami past Orlando City to Leagues Cup finalLionel Messi delivered another masterclass as Inter Miami stormed into the Leagues Cup final with a 3-1 victory over 10-man Orlando City in Fort Lauderdale on Wednesday night. The Argentine superstar struck twice and provided an assist in a decisive 15-minute spell that turned the semi-final on its head.

Watch: Emma Raducanu gives her verdict on Carlos Alcaraz's special buzzcutEmma Raducanu defended Carlos Alcaraz's new buzzcut at the US Open, saying his confidence makes the style work despite mixed reactions. The Brit also stormed into the third round with a dominant win over Janice Tjen, setting up a clash with Elena Rybakina.

RCB's first post in 3 months after Bengaluru stampede: The silence was griefRoyal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) on Thursday ended their three-month silence on social media following the horrific stampede that marred their maiden Indian Premier League (IPL) title celebrations in June.

Aryna Sabalenka, Ben Shelton advance to third round in straight setsDefending champion Aryna Sabalenka battled through a sluggish start to defeat unseeded Russian Polina Kudermetova 7-6(4), 6-2 on Wednesday and advance to the third round of the US Open, while American Ben Shelton thrilled the New York crowd a day later with a commanding 6-4, 6-2, 6-4 victory over Pablo Carreno-Busta.

'No class, no education': Townsend, Ostapenko in ugly exchange at US OpenTaylor Townsend's stunning 7-5, 6-1 win over Jelena Ostapenko at the 2025 US Open was overshadowed by a heated post-match spat, where Ostapenko accused her of lacking "class" and "education."

Man United's historic humiliation at Grimsby: Under-fire Amorim apologises to fansCarabao Cup 2025: Manchester United slipped to a new low when they lost 11-12 on penalties to Grimsby Town, suffering their first-ever defeat to a fourth-tier club. Manager Ruben Amorim was visibly shaken as he apologised to fans after the humiliation at Blundell Park.

Carlos Alcaraz crushes Mattia Bellucci, Casper Ruud stunned by World No.107Carlos Alcaraz powered past Italy's Mattia Bellucci 6-1, 6-0, 6-3 to reach the US Open third round while Casper Ruud slumped to a defeat at the hands of World No.107 Raphael Collignon.

Daniil Medvedev handed USD 42,500 fine for dramatic US Open meltdownDaniil Medvedev's turbulent 2025 season hit a low at the US Open, where a first-round loss to Benjamin Bonzi and a furious outburst cost him a hefty fine. The setback capped a miserable Grand Slam year, with the Russian advancing past the opening round only once all season.

No world record, but Armand Duplantis wins 5th straight Diamond League titleArmand Duplantis won the men's pole vault at the Diamond League final in Zurich, clearing 6.00m before falling short of the meet record. The Swede now owns five Diamond League titles, just two shy of the all-time record.

US Open: Novak Djokovic rolls into Round 3, equals Roger Federer's recordNovak Djokovic secured a second-round win over Zachary Svadja in the US Open men's singles competition. He will now be up against the winner between Cameron Norrie and Francisco Comesana.

Emma Raducanu into third round after 4 years, 5th seed Draper withdrawsEmma Raducanu stormed into the US Open third round with a 6-2, 6-1 win over Janice Tjen — her first deep run in New York since her 2021 title. The Brit hit 16 winners and 8 aces, while fellow Brit Jack Draper pulled out of the men's draw with injury.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi headlines PKL 12 season opener on National Sports DayPro Kabaddi League Season 12 kicks off on National Sports Day with sporting icons Pullela Gopichand, Dhanraj Pillay, Pardeep Narwal, and Vaibhav Suryavanshi uniting as kabaddi celebrates its roots with new formats and fierce rivalries.

Duleep Trophy 2025: Full squads, schedule, livestreaming details and moreThe Indian domestic season is all set to start with the Duleep Trophy starting on August 28. With the selectors keeping a keen eye on domestic performances, the players will be eager to impress during the tournament being played in Bengaluru.

Neeraj Chopra at Diamond League final: When and where to watch, all you need to knowNeeraj Chopra will return to action and aim for his second Diamond trophy as he steps onto the track against a strong lineup. Here's all you need to know about the Diamond League final event in Zurich.

PV Sindhu reaches pre-quarters after 4 years, Satwik-Chirag into Round of 16BWF World Championships 2025: PV Sindhu came back from behind to beat Malaysia's Karupathevan Letshanaa in the second round. The 2019 champion will face a stern test in the pre-quarterfinals on Thursday.

Sanju Samson flexible enough to drop down batting order, says mentor Raiphi GomezFormer Kerala cricketer, Raiphi Gomez, suggested that Sanju Samson is more than flexible to bat lower down the order if the team needs it considering the return of Shubman Gill in the Asia Cup 2025 squad.

Day 4 Highlights: Sabalenka beats Kudermetova Alcaraz, Djokovic storm into Round 3US Open 2025 Day 4 Live Updates: Calos Alcaraz has made light work of his Italian opponent Mattia Bellucci to storm into the third round. Novak Djokovic and Taylor Fritz were made to work hard for their victories. Aryna Sabalenka also advanced to the third round.

Dharambir and Preeti Pal lead India at World Para Athletics in New DelhiDharambir and Preeti Pal were named India's flag bearers for the World Para Athletics Championships. The showpiece event will be held in New Delhi from September 27 to October 5.

Fearless and go all out: Ashu Malik ready to lead Dabang Delhi's new era in PKLReady to go all out this season, Ashu Malik is all set to lead Dabang Delhi's charge for another Pro Kabaddi League title. The 23-year-old opens up on taking up captaincy, missing Naveen Kumar within the squad and more.

Neeraj Chopra names biggest rival, new 90m target ahead of Diamond League finalSpeaking to the press on the eve of the Diamond League Final in Zurich, Neeraj Chopra said he is hoping to consistently throw beyond the 90m mark. The two-time Olympic medalist said he is focusing on improving his technique under coach Jan Zelezny's guidance.

After IPL retirement, R Ashwin keen to play in The Hundred: ReportAfter retiring from the IPL, Ravichandran Ashwin is eyeing overseas leagues, with reports linking him to The Hundred in 2026. The spin legend could boost the tournament's profile, though his participation is yet to be confirmed.

Pro-wrestler assault: Hospitalised Stu gets financial supportWWE Superstar Rusev showed strong support for injured wrestler Syko Stu after Raja Jackson's unscripted attack on him. Rusev boosted a GoFundMe that has already got around 138K US Dollars so far.

Centre clears India's Commonwealth Games 2030 bid, names Ahmedabad as ideal hostThe Union Cabinet has approved India's bid to host the 2030 Commonwealth Games in Ahmedabad. This move aims to boost the country's sports profile and support its Olympic hosting ambitions.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
